instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power Cycles
threads.message: Liquid damage. All rails are present. Fans cycle. <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> cycles 1.147V to 0. Diode mode .002. Dead CPU? Thanks. Have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power Cycles
threads.message: Liquid damage where? What is resistance to GND on Vcore, not diode mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power Cycles
threads.message: Hi. 5.0 Ohm resistance to ground. Looks like its been worked on before. Damage seems to be around <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7569</CAPACITOR>. Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power Cycles
threads.message: Oh if <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> was messed with the CPU is probably dead already.
